isis.stitle: STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, STANDARD AND TILT - 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - STEERING COLUMN

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 2 , Figure 3, Figure 4 and Figure 5.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Stationary Column, 3800 and Flat Back Cowls
Figure 4. Tilt Column, 3800 and Flat Back Cowls

step1.para: Disconnect the battery negative terminal cable.
Remove the pinch bolt from the yoke at the steering gear.
Remove the steering wheel as previously outlined and install the steering wheel mounting nut to prevent the steering column from sliding out of the steering column housing.
Remove the steering column trim cover (if applicable).
Remove the electrical connectors and wiring from the steering column housing.
Remove the screws attaching the steering column rubber seal to the dash panel (if applicable).
Remove the bolts attaching the steering column support tube to the dash panel and remove steering column assembly.
Remove the steering wheel mounting nut, and remove the steering shaft assembly.
Assemble the steering shaft assembly and install in the steering column housing. Install the steering wheel mounting nut temporarily.
Guide the lower portion of the steering column assembly through the opening in the dash panel (if applicable). Position the shaft assembly on the steering gear.
Install the bolts attaching the steering column housing to the steering column support bracket and tighten to 34 to 42 ft-lbs. (46 to 57 N•m).
Install the screws attaching the steering column rubber seal to the dash panel (if applicable).
Install the electrical connectors and wiring in the steering column housing.
Install the steering column trim cover (if applicable).
Install the steering wheel as previously outlined in STEERING WHEEL, Install.
Install the nut and bolt in the yoke assembly and tighten until non-threaded portion above the plastic collar shears off.
Connect the battery negative terminal cable.
